entry.value:
[{"id":"JT-48324","entityId":"25-2054140","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"48324"},{"name":"summary","value":"State doesn't disappear when deleted from the available value list"},{"name":"description","value":"

While editing a list of available issue states (issue field "State"), I remove one unnecessary state ("Won't fix").
Expected results => list of available states is reduced.
Actual result => the removed state remains in the list.
To understand that the value has been deleted, I need to click on any other field, then return to the "State" => the value has been removed.
The sandbox project is located in the "MyJetBrains" cloud.

Sounds like JT-30838.

When removing a value, I choose "Replace with "Submitted" option.
It seems that the number of values is reduced (decreased by 1), but the list isn't refreshed.

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1531994267542"},{"name":"updated","value":"1532003808338"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"rekolobov"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Roman Kolobov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Vitaly.Gordeev"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Vitaly Gordeev"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Custom Fields"],"valueId":["Custom Fields"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Verified by","value":[{"value":"rekolobov","fullName":"Roman Kolobov"}]},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 71","id":"YouTrack:sprint 71"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2962821","author":"rekolobov","authorFullName":"Roman Kolobov","issueId":"JT-48324","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Can confirm it reproduces (while the total counter for values of bundle does decrease)

STR:

  1. Launch on any yt build on any non-empty DB
  2. Go to /admin/customFieldsConfiguration
  3. Select any project's custom field with value bundle
  4. Remove any value from bundle (choose either replacement or complete removal).

ER: value is removed from the list
AR: value stays in the list (but is removed on the backend). The list would be updated after you reload the page or switch to another custom field and back.

Since fix this events on the backend is extremely expensive. We decided:

1 In separated history-changes no need to show previews. Only for history that attached to comment
2 No need to show preview for deleted attachments
3 Added attachment need to show on the next line after title "Attachments"

1 In separated history-changes no need to show previews. Only for history that attached to comment

@Artem Tiunov do you mean not to show added attachments at all or show just a name of an attachment? In any case we should show something.

3 Added attachment need to show on the next line after title "Attachments"

you've said that it's not necessary to show label "Attachments" if only one attachment was added

"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1532000895458"},{"name":"updated","value":"1532001326855"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"maksimrv"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksim Ryzhikov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"maksimrv"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Maksim Ryzhikov"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-45884","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"YTB-731","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 71","id":"YouTrack:sprint 71"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1.png","id":"74-546851","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1.png?file=74-546851&c=true"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"JT-46057","entityId":"25-1881434","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"46057"},{"name":"summary","value":"New UI: "Load more" is irritating for issues with many comments"},{"name":"description","value":"
Recently YouTrack has changed how comment paging works. Before the change I was able to quickly access last comments, read them, and reply. Now I have to click "Load more" until I finally access the desired comment. More over, the issue doesn't remember I clicked "Load more" several times, and next time I visit this page I will clicking again. Could you please fix such behavior and provide quick access to last comments as old YouTrack had?

Demo issue https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/JRE-526
"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1519987891543"},{"name":"updated","value":"1532001176800"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"maksimrv"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksim Ryzhikov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"kb"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Konstantin Bulenkov"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"JT-46387","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"JT-45884","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"YTB-731","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"xi-eye","fullName":"Alexander Anisimov"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 71","id":"YouTrack:sprint 71"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1520263567002.png","id":"74-499285","url":"https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/_persistent/image1520263567002.png?file=74-499285&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2731102","author":"mazine","authorFullName":"Maxim Mazin","issueId":"JT-46057","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Dmitry Gizatov, @Maksim Ryzhikov, @Alexander Anisimov: I guess in «oldest first» mode "load more" should be on the top and should load older comments.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1520263498436,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2731107","author":"mazine","authorFullName":"Maxim Mazin","issueId":"JT-46057","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Konstantin Bulenkov Please try ‘Newest first’ mode. It's not a complete solution for this issue but a sort of workaround that can help you.

{"id":"JT-47780","entityId":"25-2026938","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"JT"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"47780"},{"name":"summary","value":"Show diff details in a history view is not shown in case it's the first item with the following expand control [...]"},{"name":"description","value":"
If the history item contains ...(triple dot) button and i click on Details - they are not expanding.
For example try to expand details of first history item on this issue DTRC-25281
"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"created","value":"1529572010733"},{"name":"updated","value":"1531769167594"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"xi-eye"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Anisimov"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"Alexey.Korovin"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Alexey Korovin"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"votes","value":"1"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"YTB-731","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"xi-eye","fullName":"Alexander Anisimov"}]},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Single Issue View"],"valueId":["Single Issue View"],"color":null},{"name":"Component","value":["Frontend"],"valueId":["Frontend"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Browser","value":["Chrome"],"valueId":["Chrome"],"color":null},{"name":"OS","value":["Windows 10"],"valueId":["Windows 10"],"color":null},{"name":"Fix versions","value":["2018.2.next"],"valueId":["2018.2.next"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"sprint 71","id":"YouTrack:sprint 71"}]},{"name":"voterName","value":[{"value":"Tatiana.Shabaeva","fullName":"Tatiana Shabaeva"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"27-2920463","author":"Mikhail.Kapusta","authorFullName":"Mikhail Kapusta","issueId":"JT-47780","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

STR:

  1. Open new FSI with changes (it should contains Summary changed: Details and show more changes button)
  2. Expand Details
    AR: nothing will happen (there is no details).
    N.B. click on "show more changes button" and then click on Details -- it works
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1529574784497,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":"YouTrack Team","markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"27-2920466","author":"Mikhail.Kapusta","authorFullName":"Mikhail Kapusta","issueId":"JT-47780","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Alexey Korovin
Thank you for the bug,
temporary workaround: click on show more changes button (triple dot) and then expand Details
